bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Thomas Ewing (1789-1871), of Lancaster, Ohio, was the father of Hugh Boyle Ewing (1826-1905) and Thomas Ewing, Jr. (1829-1896); and the foster father of William Tecumseh Sherman (1820-1891). Thomas Ewing was a lawyer who spent some time in politics as a Whig, serving as prosecuting attorney for Fairfield County, Ohio; U. S. Senator from Ohio; U. S. Secretary of the Treasury; U. S. Secretary of the Interior; delegate to the Peace Convention;and, delegate to the Union National Convention (1865).
